text: <@U1P1ZV6RF> - we have some scalability (peak throughput vs. number of nodes) measurements in-progress on state-machine replication protocols (will post once ready)
<@U0Y14MWA2> : thanks. BTW, I really liked your paper. It's very layman-friendly.
thanks - it was written that way on purpose (for the same reason, some may say it is handwavy...)

which papers would you recommend that are closest to describe (P)BFT as present/planned in Hyperledger Fabric? I went through Liskov/Castro but it applies to a PoC used for consensus-driven NFS and obviously was not envisaging Blockchain-related application.
v0.5 and v0.6 PBFT is a superset of Castro/Liskov TOCS'02
(except for the diff in signatures in view change which is a-la OSDI'99)
but now what we are doing (led by <@U0XR6J961>) is effectively a new protocol
is it "Raft" that you are talking about?
no - raft is crash tolerant protocol
what we are doing now is simplifying pbft slightly on one hand - but hardening it where necessary
simplifcation involves, e.g., removal of watermarks
